Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at the far western end of the High Road”
Reviews.Author: Corb2000
Reviews.Content: Booked this for the weekend for a good room only rate through lastminute.com as a 'top secret' hotel, (not hard to see which hotel it was from the description). Arrived late and parked in the basement car park before checking in. First impressions of the car park were poor, it is full of leaves and windblown debris and feels rather unused, but the hotel reception and common areas were both contemporary and attractive. Check in was quick although the Friday night music in the adjoining bar was so loud that the receptionist had trouble making herself heard. Our room was on the first floor facing the High Road and well insulated from both traffic and the noisy music in the bar, it was very attractive with two wardrobes and a large bathroom. Unfortunately the bathroom lighting foxed us for a while and we spent our first 24 hours washing in very low light. Eventually we figured out that the lightswitch also acted as a dimmer and you increase the brightness by holding it down. We did not have breakfast or use the restaurant during our stay so cannot comment on the food. We would have used the bar but the music was too loud for conversation so we headed up the High Road instead. Gunnersbury tube is very close although note that services to this station are more limited than on other parts of the tube system. Bit of a mix up at checkout as we had not got a parking ticket when we drove in. Parking is £12.50 per 24 hours so allow for this when you are looking at the room rates. We would go back if the room rates are reasonable as the accommodation is very nice but shame they don't control the volume more in the bar as we would like to have used this.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paddy's”
Reviews.Author: fatron
Reviews.Content: Stayed for single saturday night on St Patricks day. In London to watch the rugby at Twickenham and this hotel was perfectly positioned. Its about 200m from Gunnersbury tube on the District line. The Moran is modern and friendly with nicely designed rooms, plenty of storage space and comfortable beds.The bathrooms are modern and well equipped if a little strangely decorated. My room was very slightly battered, but in no way did this take away from the overall good impression. The bar was buzzy and a nice place to spend a couple of hours. We didnt use the restaurant We booked through Lastminute.com secret hotels, but had worked out which hotel it was before paying.The room rate was very goodvalue and I will definately return

Reviews.Title: “A conveniently positioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: coolcrok
Reviews.Content: A bit of a strange one this. Its an Irish hotel in Chiswick positioned towards the West end of Chiswick High Road - so it is within a 15 minute walk of the wonderful 'village of Chiswick' and not far from the North bank of the river/Strand-on-the-Green and Kew. But where we had our reservations was the 'disco-style' bar with loud thumping music and very dim lighting, more befitting of a night club than a hotel bar. We felt excluded although we had a quick drink and sat in the dark! Just never seen anything like this in a hotel bar before, apart perhaps in Dublin. The restaurant was disappointingly empty so we went out....and had great fun in Chiswick village where there are a multitude of great places to eat and drink! NB Our room was quite nice.......£120 (no breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reen_11
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to London for my cousin's wedding. We booked 2 rooms in this hotel and it is due to being close to where my cousin lived. It is a 2 blocks away from the underground lube. So traveling around the city, is convenient. However, location to central London is a little further if you want to be closer to all the sight seeings landmarks. There are cafes for breakfast about a 5-10 minute walk. The design for the hotel is modern, and a nice bathtub size. The design for the shower was modern, but not super powerful. The room was a large size consider how I know some hotels in London is super small. Wifi is only free at the lobby, which I find a little inconvenient. Other than that, super clean hotel and staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, breakfast overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: AliWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: Booked two nights via Last minute. Excellent value for massive room- one super king size and separate 'area' with single bed. Bathroom wonderful, walk in power shower and big bath. Clean and comfy. Breakfast not included, £15 for full 'irish' or £5 for sausage or bacon roll. Had the roll the first day- tea/ coffee included but uninspiring. Walked 7 mins down road to a fab cafe second day and got full English for £4.95- wonderful! Why they don't charge less for breakfast at the weekend when it's sightseers not business people I don't know! 3 mins walk from Ginnersbury station on district line, 20 mins into centre London from there. 20 mins walk past tube station to lovely area with lots of shops, cafes if you want something different to eat. Would stay again now we found a breakfast cafe!

Reviews.Title: “Rugby weekend”
Reviews.Author: CarolynRadcliff
Reviews.Content: We staying in the Chiswick Moran on 24th February for 2 nights having driven down from Manchester and having had stayed at the hotel on 2 previous occasions. Arriving late on the Friday night we ordered food in the Globe Bar - sadly the service was extremely slow, and they weren't that busy. The music was loud in the bar,and seemed to be catering for locals rather than hotel staff. It was almost impossible to have a conversation as the music was so loud. The Saturday night we opted to eat in the restaurant - but again extremely slow service. Not what we had experienced on our previous stays. Again music playing in the bar on the Saturday night - though not quite as intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend”
Reviews.Author: Bristol B
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for two nights over the weekend. Was very good and I would thoroughly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “In the words of "shakin stevens" - Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Duval D
Reviews.Content: A refreshing change from other London hotels, the Moran offers you excellent service, real value for money and a bit of peace and quiet. A special mention must to to Neil (Head of Sales) who was an absolute delight to deal with after we changed our requirements last minute, he took this within his stride and didn't make us feel like just another customer. Breakfast was served quickly and was of excellent quality. Whether you are on a shopping, sports or couples weekend, this is the hotel. Consider it recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, easy reach of central London”
Reviews.Author: Jane W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a weekend family break to London and it was ideal for us. It's very close to the tube station and an easy half hour journey in, enabling us to see the sights but stay in a far more comfortable hotel than we'd have got for the price in central London itself. It's also close to the London Science and Natural History museums, and Kew Gardens is just a nice stroll down the river path. We'd booked 3 standard rooms but were upgraded to deluxe, which was an unexpected bonus. The bath is to die for, simply huge and so luxurious. There was also a big shower cubicle. The chaise longue in our rooms was a nice extra touch. Customer service was great- we had a few minor requests re heating controls and bathroom fans which were swiftly and courteously attended to. Take your own bottle of water - the ones in the room are £3.50 each! We liked the fact that the day tube travel cards are valid on buses too. There is a very frequent bus service down the High Street and the bus stops just outside the hotel. Rather than eat out in the centre, we caught the bus down the high street where there is a great choice of restaurants- we went to Pizza Express but there is also Cafe Rouge and lots others. The bus also goes to White City/ Shepherd's Bush where there is an excellent Westfield Shopping Centre, which our teenage girls simply loved. Just a short bus journey away! The only slight disappointment was that the hotel website said it was possible to buy day passes to Esporta Health Club at reduced rates, so we all took our costumes as we planned to fit in a swim. The deal no longer applies and we felt that the website should have been amended to say so, as that was one of the reasons we chose the hotel. It didn't matter as we were very busy, and still had a great time, but it was misleading. All in all, highly recommended and we would return!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Lovely Room”
Reviews.Author: Hanya2112
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night and it was beautiful, we booked it as Lastminute.com's Luxury top secret hotel for £50. It is very close to the tube station and it takes about half an hour to get into central london, changing at hammersmith. We were shown to our beautiful room, (231) it was relatively compact but good things come in small packages. The bathroom was amazing a lovely big bath as well as a double shower on the opposite wall. We asked for hotel robes that were sent up immediately and when we ran out of tea we called and asked for more and they came up with a big bag full of coffee and tea and milk. The only thing I would advise is that the food in the hotel is very expensive so I would advise having dinner somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: SjClarke_24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we went to see a show in London. It is a little on the outskirts of the centre however worth the underground rides to get to the hotel. The breakfast was great and the rooms are fab. We had champagne and brownies delivered to the room and could not fault the service. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit chilly”
Reviews.Author: Godzilladude
Reviews.Content: This is a generic business class hotel, a bit longer in the tooth. Still in generally good shape. Rooms were adequate, but nothing great. The internet connection was a hardwire, and it was so short that my laptop had to sit in exactly one precise place, which was not especially comfortable. No wifi available for the rooms, which is just silly. The room was also cold. The thermostat said 18, and despite all my pushing of buttons, would not change. I chatted with the front desk that night and they said there was some kind of computer glitch with some new software, and they would have to alter the temp from the front desk. She immediately picked up a phone and said no problem, it'll get done. But in fact, no luck. Talked to the front desk again the next day, same answer, same show of picking up the phone and making a call, same "it'll be taken care of right now", and nothing. Third day, exactly the same routine. I suppose they had been coached to do that, but it seems a poor choice when the client is going to immediately know that it didn't get fixed. Other than sleeping in thermals, it was an OK stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Stratplans
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. A clean modern lobby with a bar that looked like it can be quite busy at times. Room was clean and fairly spacious by London standards, although the furnishings suggested Austin Powers. Staff was helpful and courteous. I will stay here again wen I return.

Reviews.Title: “Curate's egg”
Reviews.Author: boppsey
Reviews.Content: Good bits Good decor, comfy big bed, quiet at the back of the hotel, clean, light, low light for night use in the bathroom, nice selection of fresh fruit at breakfast, lots of wardrobe space, TV speaker in bathroom. Not so good bits Style triumphs over practicality- Black lampshades on 'reading' lights, hairdryer fixed at opposite end to mirror. Over bath (and not very good) shower.'Make your own' tea at breakfast with flasks of not quite boiling water. No biscuits in the room.Would have expected more service at breakfast for the price. Very pricy internet access. Very small gym.

Reviews.Title: “Functional but good”
Reviews.Author: ChalkyD
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night only and it was chosen by my brother for a base for a family get together. It is what it is; a good functional hotel convenient for west london and Heathrow being very close to the tube and direct road access almost from the door. The room was clean and spacious and the cooked breakfast served fresh rather than a buffet under heat lamps. The staff were friendly and I would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - beside tube station”
Reviews.Author: MarySandyford
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - just across the road from the tube station. Easily accessible from Heathrow. Lovely location - leafly Chiswick.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel_addict_bb
Reviews.Content: Very nice and modern hotel. Globe Bar food at the hotel was shocking good. Very close proximity to Gunnersbury subway line which can take you everywhere in London. Buy a whole day pass costs around 10 USD if planned to use the subway more than 5 times per day.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: PescosMum
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Moran on business and was unimpressed by it. It is an unfriendly hotel and although it is advertised as having a gym/ spa, both are a short walk away. Not at all conveniant. The decor was chilly - mint greens and pale blues, and the rooms were small. It wasnt what i expected for the price my company paid. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, quite rude staff.”
Reviews.Author: miss_igirisu
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through lastminute.com, using their service where your hotel is a secret until last minute. I asked for somewhere near Heathrow, with good access to the centre of London. Chiswick Moran hotel is in Zone 3, so people who need to get there by train as I did would need to buy the more expensive travel card. The hotel is very close to the station (less than a 2 minute walk) but the station itself has no lifts so it can be a pain with luggage. It's on the District Line, with trains coming normally every 10 minutes or so, though when I was there they were much less frequent. In order to get to Heathrow, you would need to go back to Hammersmith then go back on yourself. I wouldn't say it was convenient. My room was lovely, clean and fresh. The gossip and fashion magazines put out for me were a nice touch. The bathroom was a little weird with its triangular toilet and sink, but overall the room was excellent. I also ordered room service, which came quickly, was good value for money and tasty. The area around the hotel seemed pretty safe, and it was quite quiet too. When I booked, I was told that there was free internet, which was great because I had a bit of work to do during my stay. When I turned on my laptop I was told that the internet in my room costs 15 pounds a day. I needed to use it, so paid out. When I when to the main desk, I asked the girl there about the advertised free internet. She told me it referred to the one public computer in the corner. I replied that they might want to re-word their description on the website, to which she gave me a somewhat sassy reply and said that since the public computer was free, it's ok. As I left the hotel on my last day (after 2 nights), I decided to use the public computer as it had a printer. I was told to insert coins into the machine in order to use the computer. I don't mind paying for internet - though 15 pounds a day for wireless and 1 pound for 10 minutes on a public computer is extremely expensive - but the false advertising and the sass from the girl at the desk really made me mad. Though the hotel overall was very nice, the location wasn't really what I was looking for and the attitude of the staff was very off-putting. There was one trainee boy there on my last morning who was friendly and polite but otherwise they ranged from unfriendly to sassy.

Reviews.Title: “Another super stay.”
Reviews.Author: WayOutWest76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of times this year and really do rate this friendly, efficient and comfortable hotel. True, it doesn't have all the facilities that some would want, but should satisfy the needs of most. This time I was in a larger room that had a walk-in shower. Not the strongest shower I have ever come across, but it did not spray water across the entire bathroom, which is a common problem I have found with hotel walk-in showers. There is also a separate bath for those who want one. I still find the odd shaped basin hard to use (but I'm getting over it). For the first time I used the Globe Bar downstairs to have my evening meal. The choice of food is decent enough and although slightly on the expensive side it isn't ridiculous, especially as the service is good. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “good value, very accessible”
Reviews.Author: Hollandx3
Reviews.Content: We stayed last sunday night. The hotel is very easy to get to being seconds off the m4. The hotel is has its own parking and its outside of the congestion charge zone. The hotel staff were all welcoming and our room was absolutely fine. The hotel is less than 5mins walk from Gunnersbury tube allowing easy travel into Central London (25mins). We booked through Lastminute at a cost of under £70. If its value for money you are after this is a great stay. If I could pick a hole in our stay it would be: decorations might be a little dated, and the view from the (odd) numbered rooms is not great, but hey ho, you don't go to Chiswick for the views do you? On the whole this is a good hotel. Well done Moran!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly...Great location.”
Reviews.Author: ORA1999
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just the one night and, to be very honest,we did not spend that much time in the hotel but whilst there the hotel staff were very polite and professional. We booked a "Twin Room",but we were given a "Double".Not a problem as it was changed immediately.The room was spacious and very clean.If you wuold like a quiet room,we would suggest you ask for a room at the rear of the hotel.(Didn't bother us,we could sleep on a runway) Great location.Five minutes to Gunnesbury station and a10 minute walk into Chiswick high street. NB.Got this hotel off "Top Secret Hotels"...£70 Room only..BARGAIN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Air pollution....”
Reviews.Author: A_disappointed_guest
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel for a weekend and found my request for a quiet room, honoured. Good start, however it stank of cigarette smoke! This issue was never resolved as my options were to stay put with a skoosh of airspray or move to a front facing noisy room on the first floor - nothing else available apparently. Not much of a choice. The decor was very 70's in flavour which in itself was do-able until one walked into the bathroom to find floor to ceiling yellow tiles. If I wasn't feeling sick before I went for my bath I certainly was when I emerged (lovely huge bath by the way). Suffering two nights passively breathing someone elses toxic fumes kind of put a damper on the whole experience. Otherwise a good location for Kew but nothing else was open in November. ps The hotel deducted the cost of one breakfast but only after arms were twisted - customer care issues require a look really, and maybe a steam clean of that carpet - you know its worth it. Sorry Chiswick Moran

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in trendy part of town”
Reviews.Author: EnglishJero
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, though its cool decor is sort of forgettable, just a background series of colours that leave no impression. However: the staff were very friendly and helpful and helped out with my usual idiotic questions, and even found my coat (and wallet) after I left them in the bar overnight. (I suspect they'll remember the look of relief for some time). Good location for Chiswick High Street, though if you don't want a 20 minute walk to the Devonshire Road eateries, get a cab. Downsides: breakfast was ok but not outstanding but the coffee was possibly the worst I've ever had in a hotel. Like weakly flavoured mud. Ugh. It really was bad. Also, there is parking but the ceiling is low in the car park - I've got a Land Rover Defender and suspect it wouldn't have fitted.

Reviews.Title: “everythings great apart from the restaurant breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Andrew M
Reviews.Content: Have stayed for the last 4 years with my wife on a weekend london break on the basis of easy tube/ bus access, great room and bar. This time I left feeing as bit hard done by. The sound system in room did not work and shower teperature control could not be moved colder with brute force. Still these are only small points. Room was clean and as good as ever. I've never written a review before, We rather put up with small things than complain as it puts me in a bad mood for the whole stay. My gripe is the restaurant. We always eat out in Chiswick at night after the first years poor meal in the hotel but breakfast this year was below par. It's now gone that you now even have to make your own toast ! Not what you expect at a four star hotel. Fresh tea ,coffee and toast should be brought by waiters to your table. Service and layout makes it more like a self service canteen. Cooked breakfaxt was ordered but when it came it didn't appear to have been freshly cooked. Scrambled egg the next day was OK. Guests should be pampered a bit more for what they pay. I know its London and nowhere is cheap but the hotel appears to be taking backward steps. I love the rooms, bar and spacious lobby. Just improve in the restaurant. Writing this has stressed me out. I can't believe it that some people do this all the time. Lifes to short. Anyway thanks to the hotel. Please don't blacklist me as we will probably be back again next year. Over and out.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and I will not be returning”
Reviews.Author: Dennis S
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 days on business, and what a disappointment this hotel has been. Let me start off with what is good. The rooms and decor is trendy. The bed was clean. On the negative side, the rooms stank or rancid water. I was able to move to a new room, but the bathroom stank just as badly. When I closed the bathroom door, the smell was not as bad. The service and attitude of the staff is appalling. I got the impression that “trendy” really means unfriendly and unwelcome. As a paying customer, I was so surprised at how aggressive the staff are, they were rude, arrogant and unhelpful. Most could not manage a smile or a greeting, even when I approached them, I always had to initiate the conversation. The attention to detail is poor and there are many examples of this throughout the hotel. The hotel looks tired and most of the public areas are grubby. I ate at the resturant and ordered room service, it arrived quickly but the food was uninspiring. I used the internet in my room, it cost 15 pounds for 24 hours, I found that expensive. My company and my staff use this hotel regularly, however, I will ensure we change our preference to another hotel – my experience was that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtful staff, cool mod, but comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: nammyohorengekyo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great deal through booking.com. Got a flash deal at $85 Canadian per night. The room was spacious, clean, beautiful design (see photos) and fairly quiet, despite being next to the elevator. Travelling throughout the UK, we got used to being greeted with cookies and tea with each hotel we stayed in. However, there were no cookies in this hotel. So, late one night when we returned to the hotel, close to midnight, we asked at the bar if was possible to get some cookies or pastries to go with tea before we went to bed. The bartender, a young woman, who seemed kindly amused by my request, said no problem, even though the kitchen was closed. She came back with a generous full plate of assorted shortbread cookies and said no charge with a warm smile. We were very touched by this. It is this type of kind and spontaneous gesture that truly stands out amongst all the things you notice when on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in leafy Chiswick”
Reviews.Author: Bel422
Reviews.Content: Friends and family have stayed here in the past and recommended this hotel as a great place to stay in West London. Last weekend a friend and I checked into the Chiswick Moran, the staff are friendly, check-in was a breeze. The hotel decor is modern and the rooms are spacious, beds are comfy and the room was quiet. The location is great, just 2 minutes walk to Gunnersbury tube on the District Line, we were in the centre of London in approx 20 minutes. There is also a bus stop out the front of the hotel, that can take you straight to Westfield in Shepherds Bush, just jump on the 237 and it will take you to Westfield in approx 15-20 minutes. Also took the opportunity to have dinner down on Chiswick High Road. The High Road has plenty of restaurants to choose from, it takes about 10 minutes to walk down to where all the restaurants start. We ate at Yupa's Thai and it was the best Thai food I have ever eaten. Cant fault this London hotel, great value, modern decor, friendly staff and easy access to various transport links.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kimqs
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, for a good price! Nice design rooms! They need a little of touch up... Nice silence rooms and all comfort you need.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel very good transport links”
Reviews.Author: HelenIng
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a weekend whilst visiting London, it was clean excellent facilities. It was straight off the M4, parking was very reasonable, close to tube stations and a bus stop outside which was a pleasent ride too Hammersmith. Good choice of restaurants in Chiswick which is a twenty minute walk. We booked direct with the hotel and got a better deal than any of the hotel booking sites, we also got a full English Breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money! What a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: whichwayup
Reviews.Content: Fantastic value for money if booked in advance or last minute (through lastminute.com) £74 room only on a Friday night (booked 1 day in advance). Fabulous location and within 2 minutes walk from Gunnesbury tube station (district line). Kew is 5 minutes down the road and Richmond not much further. The A406/205 (north/south circular) is also only 1 minute's drive away. Check in was friendly and quick. They already had my room allocated with the registration form and key card ready. The room allocated was really beautiful and clearly just fully refurbished. Unfortunately it stilled smelled quite strongly of paint so I asked to be moved to another room. They apologised and I got another room straight away. Even though this one hasn't been refurbished yet, it's still lovely and I wouldn't say tired looking at all. Swish and modern and very spacious with a very large and comfy bed. The room has a large wardrobe, TV, safe, coffee/tea making facilities and much more. I ordered some room service which was delivered promptly. Hotel food can be so awful but this was a really lovely surprise. The salmon & sweet potatoe fish cakes with salad & chips were delicious. Probably some of the best fish cakes I've ever had! Definitely freshly made (not pre-prepared in any way. Heaps of salmon with a light a tasty crispy coating. The salad was super fresh too. The chips unfortunately weren't too my taste (probably oven baked or more likely microwaved). Overall I'm super impressed with this hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel at all cost”
Reviews.Author: Docomoyo
Reviews.Content: I checked into this Hotel on 14th August 2011 as I was on a training course at EMC for three days. Upon checking in I noticed personal details of other guest all over reception, including room numbers, not clever! When I entered my room on the top floor I was pleased with the layout and space within the room. There was a modern roll top bath and a separate walk in shower cubical. Whilst taking a shower on the first night I was horrified to find body hair on the tiles of the shower cubical (photos attached). It was late and I just wanted to get to sleep as I had a 9am start on a Monday morning. Upon inspecting the bed and pillows I found even more hair including short and curlys inside the sheets on the right hand side of the bed. When you’re paying £100+ per night in a central London Hotel I have high expectations, however as I said, it was late and a few body hairs and short and curlys wasn’t going to kill me so I made sure the left hand side of the bed was clean and went to sleep. After breakfast on a Monday morning I requested to speak to the manager and out came this short guy who was the duty manager. Having explained to him my huge disappointment of finding body hair in the bed and in the shower he apologized profusely and assured me that my room would be cleaned thoroughly. I returned back at the hotel on that Monday evening from a day’s training course and went to my room. I checked the shower and the hair was still there, in exactly the same place but I was so angry that I forgot to check the bed and went straight down and complained again to another so called duty manager. She said she would get my bathroom cleaned whilst I waited in reception. The shower was cleaned as I checked it before I went down for dinner. However when I retired for the evening at 10:45 I was shocked to discover there was still hair in my bed which clearly wasn’t mine. I called down and complained again and demanded to speak to the duty manager. Initially I was told she was off duty and had left and then if by magic she had reappeared. I insisted she came to my room so she could see for herself the hair in my bed. I checked out in the morning and refused to pay the invoice for the two nights stay. I would avoid this hotel at all cost and stay at the Premier Inn nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel in nice area”
Reviews.Author: 2TravellersBristol
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now, both times very enjoyably. The hotel's communal areas are lovely, the staff very helpful, and the continental breakfast very good as well. Rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable. Gunnersbury tube station is just across the road, and you can be in central London in 20 minutes. It's also very close to the A4/M4, so visitors from the west can get home again easily. We would definitely continue to stay here when we visit London.

Reviews.Title: “october half term”
Reviews.Author: gareth c
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel with my wife and daughter on a family trip this being the second time we stayed as last year we found it very friendly and convenient for the tube back into london, however this time we found the reception staff quite abrasive and unhelpful. The booking had been incorrectly transferred meaning that the breakfast reservation was not passed on and we were made to feel awkward, though i must say when eventually sorted the breakfast was adequate but not exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend”
Reviews.Author: chrissieheeley
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 3 times and always found the staff to be efficient and friendly, the hotel is very comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: leg_endBirmingham
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with my boyfriend, he had an important meeting and I planned to go shopping. We ate in the Napa restaurant, the food was very good, as was breakfast. The beds are huge and we slept very well. The hotel is placed very closed to Gunnersbury station and also has excellent bus links to the shopping centre. Overall a great stay, I would definately come back.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!! Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: erin t
Reviews.Content: Wow, what can I say. Stayed at this hotel for a girls night away (from Bristol) in a triple room. Firslty the rooms are huge and spacious and the design of the triple gives the feel of two seperate bedrooms. Absolutely fantastic for 3 girls getting ready for a night out ;o) (Or a family) Stunning design through out. Been to London many, many a times and now I wouldn't even bother looking for other hotels. Staff were fantastic and friendly. Bar was buzzing in the evening and food was fab. Thank you for such a fantastic night away!!! Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again, given the opportunity"”
Reviews.Author: Teerex51
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on its location, which is right next to a very upscale business park where I was going to spend 3 full days. I found the room ample and functional, the bathroom was also very good. A nice place to crawl back to after a stressful day's work. I especially enjoyed the opportunity to eat dinner at any of several ethnic restaurants located on the Chiswick High Road, easily within walking distance from the hotel. A few minutes to the NW of the hotel lies Gunnersbury Park, which proved an excellent solution for a 30 minute run before dinner.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: JSFULHAM
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal. £80.89 Bed and Breakfast. The hotel is at Gunnerbury Tube on the district line. Check in was smooth and friendly. The room was clean with a nice big bathroom. The furniture was a little worn, but serviceable. The bed was first rate. I had a great sleep. Breakfast was fine. I paid the £5 supplement for the cooked Irish breakfast and it arrived quickly and was great value. The continental breakfast would have been ample on its own but the cooked option was nice. British hotels and especially those in London are often overpriced, tired and nothing special. Not so here! The hotel's web site is not competitive on price. I found my deal on Hotels 4U. At the rack rate of £115.00 it would have been a fair deal but I did not want to spend that much. I am very satisfied with the price paid just don't understand why this hotel's management don't seem to expect people to shop around!

Reviews.Title: “If you need to be in or close to Chiswick, the Moran is fine (and also your only option)”
Reviews.Author: num1sherm
Reviews.Content: One short block from the Gunnersbury Underground/Overground station. One Underground stop away from Kew Gardens and two stops away from lovely Richmond with its shops, pubs, restaurants and river walk. Easy access to local office buildings too. Many restaurants and shops within 5 - 20 minutes walking distance. The bar at the Moran is huge - that's a good thing. The restaurant offers all-day meals, but we only partook in breakfast which offered several options and was a fairly good value by London standards and of good quality. Our king room was spacious by European standards, nicely laid out and comfortable with ample storage, work and seating space. Bathroom was extremely spacious and well-appointed with a wall-hung flat screen TV (not a great selection of channels though). Large walk-in shower looked so great - but, be warned, the single shower head is mounted directly overhead and only trickles water - totally unsatisfactory - just an FYI. In addition, while wireless internet access is made available only in the hotel lobby. If you want internet access in your room, it'll set you (or your employer) back 15 pounds per 24 hour period - quite steep. Overall, a fine option if you need to be in Chiswick. If you don't, I suggest something a bit less sleepy. There is a small but adequate work-out room inside the hotel, but as a Moran guest, you can purchase access to a swanky private fitness club nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, fine for single female business traveller”
Reviews.Author: Wienette
Reviews.Content: Stayed here several times over the past year and each stay has been good. A nice, clean, efficient hotel, decent restaurant. Perfect for business trips due to location and good safe feel for a single female traveller. Would recommend to anyone looking to stay in London but it does get booked up fast.

Reviews.Title: “Not great at all”
Reviews.Author: Des_traveller
Reviews.Content: I have the misfortune that I have to stay in this hotel pretty regularly with work (I work in nearby Chiswick Park) so I've got to know the place quite well by now. The food, for a 4* hotel is expensive and to be honest - terrible...always. I no longer eat in the hotel, plenty of very decent restaurants in Chiswick so happy to go there instead. The rooms themselves are pretty small, quite tacky and a bit dated. The TV in room is tiny - it might as well not be there at all. Service at the bar tends to be slow. Check in and out is ok - breakfast is slow as well. If there's anything wrong with the room (I've had curtains missing, dirty bathroom, TV not working), it will take at least two days to have it fixed. Also, you're on the district line which isn't very frequent so not that easy to get to central London from here. If it was my money paying for my trips - there's no way I'd stay here. I used to enjoy coming to London - not anymore now that I stay in this tip

Reviews.Title: “will stay here , no problem”
Reviews.Author: smudge196
Reviews.Content: Arrived early, not a problem to the very friendly and efficient staff, was allowed to leave car in the car park, came back about 5 to check in properly. Room was large and clean, comfy large bed aided a good nights sleep, no view from room but others in our party did. Had some food in the bar which was very good, had several different options between us and all were happy with our choices. Breakfast was of an equal standard The location is fantastic, a few minutes off the M4 and you are there, it is 200m to gunnersby tube station and 30 minutes to cental London, there are a few local shops and pubs. Overall i was happy that i stayed at this hotel and will stay here on future visits to London.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again without doubt”
Reviews.Author: LeedsBecky
Reviews.Content: We were going to a concert at kew gardens that's why we picked this hotel. The room was very large and clean. What a fab bathroom very chic as another review comented some good ideas for your own home. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble. The bus stop is outside the hotel to catch the bus to kew gardens. We waited ages for a bus when it did 3 came at once. We decided to walk back after because the kews were massive. Only 10 minutes walk. Breakfast was very good constantly topped up with fresh food and so clean.The staff again were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “superb value for money”
Reviews.Author: dee090
Reviews.Content: We needed to be in Chiswick area so booked here for 2 nights. got a fantastic b'n'b rate through ghr.com - so good in fact that I really was expecting a pretty grotty room next to lifts or in dingy basement. Utterly amazed when we walked into a light spacious room on the 6th floor. Large comfortable bed and huge picture window that allowed you to lie in bed and watch planes coming in to land at Heathrow. Best thing of all, however, was the silence. The soundproofing/window glazing was so good we had the quietest night I have probably ever had in any hotel within the London area. Our rate included continental breakfast which was ok - you can't really complain if you are getting a fabulous rate. All staff in hotel were friendly and helpful. We decided to get a cab back to Heathrow and hotel arranged the hotel taxi for us which cost £27. Hotel is close to Gunnersbury tube and we had taken the tube from Heathrow to hotel on arrival but as we were travelling back to Heathrow on a sunday morning we decided to take taxi as roads were quiet and we suspected tubes/connections may be slow. Hotel is situated about a 5-10 min walk from the start of the numerous shops and restaurants on Chiswick High Road & about a 10 min walk in other direction to Strand on the Green. If I ever need to be in Chiswick area again - I would definitely book here. Even at hotel normal rates, I think this hotel offers very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in West London”
Reviews.Author: melmoff
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Moran perhaps 30 times now over the last 4 years and have never had a bad stay. The staff are great and we are treated like locals. The rooms have a funky design and so good that we tried to use some of their ideas in our new house. Bar can be hopping at night and room service is very good. Breakfast is also good. Only fault is perhaps too many functoions that go on pretty late. Only get wi fi on first fllor and lobby which is a pain and should be fixed to make it totally excellent. Difficult ot get a room so book in plenty of time, especialloy mid week.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: NoonaLeicester
Reviews.Content: I can certainly recommend this hotel. My husband and I stayed for one night this weekend as we were visiting the Royal Botanical Gardens at Kew. The hotel is very comfortable, extremely clean and the staff very friendly. The rooms were an excellent size, but on a personal note, I found the pillows a little too hard. There was plenty of choice for breakfast although would have preferred more choice with the bread other than ordinary sliced, such as baguettes or rolls or as in some continental hotels uncut bread that you can cut yourself. It would also have been nice to have been given the option of a cooked breakfast but we didn't realise you had to ask for this until it was too late. All in all though we would return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A true 4* hotel conveniently located near the tube”
Reviews.Author: emileeetravels
Reviews.Content: Our room was quite comfy, new, clean, and modern with a very spacious bathroom, particularly by London standards. The location was a bit farther from all the major sites but considering the price and quality of this hotel, it was a great value and we would definitely stay here again for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and recommended!”
Reviews.Author: TonyJean121
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotels for 2 nights in my London trip this year. Although the location of this hotel is not convenient (needs almost 45 mins to zone 1 by Tube), the hotel is excellent! There is much green area around the hotel which makes us feel relax. The hotel is tidy and the staff is helpful. The room is so big and comfortable. The breakfast buffet is good and many choice there. It is a good hotel and we highly recommended to stay in there~

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations - definetley recommend!”
Reviews.Author: er1n985
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! Near lots of bars, restaurants, and lovely area. Rooms were lovely and beautifully designed! Drinks were reasonably priced. Great location for exploring London,

Reviews.Title: “Great for West London and Heathrow”
Reviews.Author: WayOutWest76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in one week last month due to work commitments and both stays were good (we have stayed previously). Just a few things bothered me slightly this time that I though worth mentioning. Firstly, one of my new pet hates, no water in the room. I don't want much, but some complimentary water in a decent hotel room isn't too much to expect. Secondly, personal opinion, a triangular basin looks fab, but if you can barely get your hands under the tap what's the point?! I would also say the shower is okay, but doesn't give you much space as the bath is quite narrow. This would probably not bother some. Finally, breakfast. A complimentary continental is no problem, but having to get your own tea and coffee when there are staff hanging around is quite irritating, even more so when the hot water runs out and isn't replenished despite being asked! The selection of bread is awful (sliced bread - white and wholemeal does not count as a selection) and the pastries are too small. For those who need a quick breakfast it is fine, for those looking for something more leisurely I'd suggest taking your own milk and cereal and enjoying it in your room! All that aside, rooms are a decent size, bed is comfortable and you have good access to Heathrow, the M4 and the Underground. Parking at £12.50 for 24 hours (for guests) is pretty good too. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved It”
Reviews.Author: emzolita
Reviews.Content: I thought the decor was gorgeous. Was supposed to be 70's chic, the bathrooms are huge. and the white bed linen is SPOTLESS clean. I actually loved how clean this hotel was. the breakfast buffet was nice, average tbh, the fruit salad was amazing tho. the residents bar meant we didnt have to go on our first night, it had a dj playing, but didnt play late enough to keep any residents awake, like some hotels do. all in all, i liked it, was pretty accessible to the city centre too, the train station is right across the road. service was good too. I would recommend it for somewhere if you wanted to stay in London but not right in the city itself.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Petruchka
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable and quiet (even though I was near the elevator). The bathroom was magnificent. The lounge was a great place to take advantage of the free wireless Service was perfunctory. With the exception of a wonderful person behind the bar, no one smiled. Breakfast on Friday was excellent, smoked salmon and perfect eggs. Then on the weekend,a buffet. I showed up early at 7:30 and it was already overcooked and underwhelming. Such possibilities lost. The coffee was very tasty. I wish there was someone walking around refilling it. The area is very easy to navigate. 4 buses stop in front of the hotel. Gunnersbury station is 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Decor”
Reviews.Author: CloudPixie
Reviews.Content: It was my second visit to the Chiswick Moran, after a rocky first one! We were given a Junior Suite, which I think a fabulous modern take on 60's style. We had dinner in the restaurant and the waiter was very attentive and helpful. A nice little oasis in leafy Kew Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “great for a quick stop”
Reviews.Author: becky_boo66
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, modern and roomy. The bar downstairs was great. Breakfast was tasty. It's a good hotel if your planning to be out a lot, close to the station.

Reviews.Title: “Not for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: jkt4me
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this hotel over the past few years for business purposes and it always disappoints me. I continually have problems with simple business needs and the staff are rarely qualified to handle the needs of an international clientele. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, whether business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “lovely room, shame about their breakfast area.”
Reviews.Author: fossil367
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault the room, it was spotless, trendy and comfortable. Massive shower room. Friendly staff on reception , early access allowed to room. Usually stay in central London and tried here for a change. Good access to Chiswick High Street which is well worth a visit, and underground network for getting into the City to see a show. Went for breakfast forty minutes before it was due to finish. No pastries / rolls left. Staff informed us they couldn't make any more as they took twenty minutes to bake despite later guests requesting some too. Same problem with items on the cooked breakfast. No sausages, diners having to wait till more were done. Tables were also left uncleared . Staff who were in the dining room appeared busy but no one appeared to be in charge and delegating duties. It's not good sitting at breakfast surrounded by masses of other diners debris. Would stay there again despite chaotic breakfast room. Maybe it was an off day. Don't be put off !!, this had the makings of a superb visit - spoilt by the lack of leadership in the breakfasting area. Easily remedied by good management.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: tat3rs
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay here on a short break to London. It's a little out of the way but the food is good, the rooms are lovely and the staff are really friendly and helpful. Will definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: BethMcBrd
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Chiswick for 1 night with my husband,we were down in London with friends celebrating a special birthday. The hotel is situated very close to the undergroud station which was excellent for travelling into London to see a show on the saturday night. The reception staff were friendly and helpful and my executive room was available at 12pm when I arrived which was a pleasant suprise. Our room was beautiful, very clean and spacious and although facing the front of the hotel and main road, due to the excellent double glazing it was very quiet. We had a drink at the bar before heading out and headed back to the bar on our return but it was a bit noisy as there had been a function on in the hotel and the guests had gathered in the bar after it had finished. We slept very well in the comfortable beds and were looking forward to our breakfasts in the morning. This I'm afraid is where our we found ourselves disappointed. We were seated with our friends before 10 in the morning,breakfast is served till 11am on a Sunday. There was an adequate continental breakfast available but with only a FOUR SLOT toaster it took 10-15mins to wait for our toast. When we went up for our Buffet Breakfast the plate dispenser was empty and unfortunately so was the buffet, apart from hot tomatoes. The waiter said it was going to be filled up but this took another 10mins and the sausages never appeared and only a small amout of bacon which ran out very quickly,meanwhile the waiting staff, who thought we had left had cleared away our tea and precious toast and so we left still hungry. My advice would be to stay at the very comfortable hotel but eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “I’m living in the 70’s!”
Reviews.Author: Fiver75
Reviews.Content: Okay, depending on your point of view, the Chiswick Moran is either very, very retro cool, or very, very dated and daggy! Retro green dominates – I was a little undecided for a while, but I recon it makes a nice change from the norm. The Chiswick is a pretty good option in London – the Gunnersbury Tube Station was a short walk away, and buses run out the front of the hotel, so you are pretty well connected. Not sure about cars – I think there was on site car parking but I didn’t use it so I am not sure... On the tube the Centre of London was only about 20 minutes away, so the hotel is not too remote. There is a nice large foyer with efficient, if a little impersonal, staff. My room was nice and big, lots of storage space and room to stretch out. There was a large work desk and internet is available, although at a ridiculous price! The room and bathroom were kept very clean and, despite a retro pattern actually seemed quite new and fresh. My room had a bath and shower – nice hot water! Altogether, a very comfortable room and a comfortable stay. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Decor a bit dated, but clean and VERY comfortable”
Reviews.Author: aitchlone
Reviews.Content: Good location - just a couple of minutes walk from the tube. Large, comfortable room. Decent (entirely self-service) breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It!!!”
Reviews.Author: AmitaP
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my partner for a weekend but we had problem after problem. firstly they gave me a standard room when i had booked an executive room. Once i saw my room i thought it was a bit standard so when i complained they admitted they had given me the wrong room. If i hadn't mentioned this then i would never have been given the room i paid for. Secondly the TV remote wouldn't work so we complained and they said they couldn't do anything until the engineer came the next day but the 2 days we were there no engineer came. Thirdly room service did an appalling job in cleaning our room. We had used the glasses and mugs but they were left there, also the bed was not made properly (personally I could have done a better job). Fourthly the A/C had a mind of its own. It kept turning on by itself. We constantly had to keep turning it off. Also I was charged for car parking but I couldn't even park my car in their car park as it was full. We complained to the manager who said he would get back to me within 72 hours but its been 5 days and still waiting. Overall we were not happy and definitely will never visit this hotel again. The worst stay ever!

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel for visit to London”
Reviews.Author: alans21
Reviews.Content: Along with another couple of friends we stayed at this hotel as part of a London show trip. we booked the hotel seperate from the show and found it to be one of the best we have stayed at when visiting London. Plenty of parking (at a reasonable charge) Just a short work to the underground which with one change you are in the West End. Will use this hotel again when visiting London for what ever reason.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a second try”
Reviews.Author: r_mooshammer
Reviews.Content: At first glance the hotel looks nice and seems to be realy good. The size of the rooms is good. Furniture, bed and mattras seemed to be quite new and comfortable. The hotel is very close to the next train station and Chiswick office park. I stayed at Chiswick Moran for a couple of nights and was dissatisfied with several things. When I checked in I asked for a quiet room away from the elevators, I got the room exactly next to the elevators! When I came into my room it was freezing cold and had to turn up the heating first. The next morning I realized there was no heating in the bath room at all which was no fun when you came out of the shower and there was not even a bathrobe. The light inside the bathroom was way too dark, probably because of energy saving bulbs. I couldn't find a socket next to the sink or close to the mirror to charge a shaver or use the non existing hair dryer. Then at breakfast it was so dark inside the restaurant that you could hardly see what you had on your plate. Refilling the coffee pot was kind of a challenge, you just couldn't see if it was filled up to the top already. Though there is a free WiFi in the lobby you are charged 15GBP per day for the use of internet in the room. Taking all that together I must say I did not realy get what I was expecting and paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, lovely decor, spacious and comfortable with v friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: FrancesH77
Reviews.Content: I booked three twin rooms for my mother, sisters, nephews and nieces at the weekend. Their ages ranged from 65 to 6 and everyone enjoyed it. I got a deal online that meant the standard room fee was less than usual - I think it was 3 nights for the price of 2, which made the stay very reasonable. I was very impressed with the hotel. It was beautifully done. Very sophisticated, contemporary and design-lead, but not at the expense of comfort. The beds were very comfortable as were the communal areas. The staff at reception and in the bar/restauarant were very helpful and friendly. The rooms were lovely and had enough space for an extra bed to be added - which the hotel staff organised for my nephew and neice - both under 7. The bar itself is lovely - a great place to come for a drink or bite to eat whether staying at the hotel or not. The only thing that I would say could nbe improved is the PC and Printer facility on the 1st floor - my sister and I both used it but we each had problems with it. Apart from that - everything was great and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone - whether for business or leisure, a romantic break or a city weekend with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, clean, comfortable and inexpensive.”
Reviews.Author: MaggieE2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through the internet for Valentines weekend, it looked nice in the pics and already had good reviews, but I was a bit sceptical as most hotels of this standard had increased thier prices for the occassion and at £158 for an immaculate, clean, well proportioned double room, with a large en-suite, it seemed inexpensive. I was not dissappointed it was lovely. Close to Gunnersbury station, within walking distance of shops, bars and easy access to the city..I can't recommend it enough. Room service was a bit expensive, but the food was excllent.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located for business in Chiswick Park; not a tourist location”
Reviews.Author: Seattle98101
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Chiswick Moran on business due to its convenience to nearby offices. It is quite adequate for that purpose, with spacious rooms and a decent onsite restaurant. I appreciate the comfortable bed, plentiful desk & closet space, large bath with walk-in shower, separate tub & night light. Breakfast is average. I wouldn't consider this a particularly good choice for leisure travelers, as it's halfway between Heathrown and the city center, in Zone 3 of the underground. The worst feature is the dreadful carpeting in the rooms - ugly, dirty stained shag. The remote control won't turn on the TV, and there's no in-room safe. The other annoyance is the hairdryer mounted in the drawer of the desk, an awkward location. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel for business travelers or anyone particularly wanting to be in this area, and if they would spruce it up a bit it could be lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stylish hotel. Lovely rooms and bathrooms.”
Reviews.Author: Pusillanimous
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times, but always at weekends when value for money is exceptional. The whole place is very stylish and there is enough room for you to be able to feel at home. Not bad communications to central LOndon but for the price, even the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel For Short Stay In London - Awesome Rooms”
Reviews.Author: NickandSophie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chiswick Moran London on a recent trip with my girlfriend. Never having been to London before this was the perfect place for money to stay. Hotel is very clean and the rooms are very modern and also clean. Was very pleased with the service as our room was not ready upon our arrival so they had our bags securely stored away for us so we could enjoy our first day sight seeing in the city. Yes the hotel is a little bit out of the way but the tube station is literally a stones throw away. No problems connecting lines and gettin back to the hotel late at night very easy and simple please do not be put off by this as i was worried at first. Breakast is very average but there is alot on offer and for the money we paid for the weekend i could not complain. Selection of cold and hot on the morning spread. Ive had worse breakfasts from 5 star hotels claiming full english on the menu well i can guarantee you will find something worth eating at the chiswick moran. Nice bar area (the globe bar) in the main reception area to wind down the evening at. Small shops are just over the road which came in handy for gettin snacks and pre alcoholic beverages. All in all i would highly recommend this hotel to others and have already done so. We are looking at returning in the very near future

Reviews.Title: “Good value and easy to get around”
Reviews.Author: johnoffurn Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as it was near access to the M25 and we were driving down from Yorkshire and had parking for our car (£10 a day). It was also near the district line (Gunnersby stop) which we needed as we were going to Tate Modern and also to see a band in the evening. The rooms were clean, had free wifi, good size bathroom with bath (for a London hotel). We were at the fornt of the hotel on 2nd floor but despite this we didn't hear much road noise at night. The staff at reception were very helpful. Breakfast which was included was continental and was good value - cooked was extra. We didn't have time to use the gym. We did use the bar where the service was good, good range of beers draft and bottled. The bar meals had a good selection and again the service was good despite being busy. We did not use the main restaurant. We are back in London in January and will be using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlightning
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 8 nights at the hotel while I attended a meeting and she saw the sights. The location is convenient (a very short walk to an underground station) and the hotel is comfortable. It is 1 stop from Kew Gardens which was a special attraction for us. The room decor is modern and this may put off some people. The staff was helpful and polite and there was little noise on the 3rd floor (except one night when some people were talking loudly in the hall). The lower floors may get noise from the bar which was occasionally quite noisy One colleague had a smell from backed up plumbing in her room and they rapidly transferred her to another room. One pet peeve I have about this hotel (and many European hotels) is the absence of alarm clocks in the room. if you are going, either bring your own or depend on a wake-up call from the desk. The fitness room had only a few pieces of equipment (2 bikes, a treadmill, 2 rowers, and free weights) but it was not heavily used and the equipment was in good shape. WiFi internet connectivity was available for free in the lobby on the ground floor and in some lounge areas on the first floor (second floor for Americans). In the rooms it was available at an extra (large) charge. Breakfast was very nice but the Napa restaurant was mediocre and overpriced. Fortunately there were a number of pretty good restaurants within a 10 minute walk. I would happily return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Surprise.”
Reviews.Author: yuki-ukko
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with a great vibe and was lucky enough to get a room on the top floor with an amazing view across the west side of London. Didn't realise London was rather green, so many trees. Room was comfortable and a great place to relax and unwind after a long day of leisure in the Capital. Moreover, the bus stop outside allowed fast access to the shops in the chiswick area and beyond to shephards bush for westfield and the underground was only a mere 5 min walk giving access to richmond in which you could take a 20min train ride to waterloo for the tourist attractions. Only bug bear is the light fixture switches, it was outwith my reach when in lying in bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mikedgYork
Reviews.Content: Great stay, Great staff, Great room, Great location.. no complaints at all would definitley reccomend thanks for an enjoyable stay..

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best place to stay in London”
Reviews.Author: Jazna4
Reviews.Content: Elegant, modern and refined decor throughout. Rooms very comfortable and chic, spacious and radiant, implacably clean. Service was excellent, staff delightfull. I'll have to give it a 5* plus.

Reviews.Title: “A REAL DELIGHT”
Reviews.Author: happychappie67
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel because we had friends who live in chiswick. A lovely place but made all the better because of Napa in the Moran Hotel. Food was amazing and such a chilled place and a great place to relax. But the whole night was made better by a irish lad Paul, he was great fom greeting us to saying good bye. Our friends are from ozz and they could not beleive how friendly and helpfull this lad was. from looking after the tables to even taking photos of us at our table. I wish the other staff behaved like him. one girl did not even smile when taking our order. but it was all saved by the chefs amazing food and of course the man who sells it so well. well done men. and thanks Paul from all of us. Gary

Reviews.Title: “my favourite hotel in west london”
Reviews.Author: hotelhappy_7
Reviews.Content: we have stayed here 3 times, last time after a gruelling long haul flight, and obviously like it enough to return. the rooms are very stylish, spacious, and the beds excellent. we ate at the napa restaurant, where the service was great, and the food really good. i had a piece of fish on top of a lemony risotto with samphire and it was amazing! we prefer to back of the hotel with views to wembley, and each floor has its own colour scheme. they staff are mostly very good, but some of the front desk people need to be a bit more professional, try talking about me after i've left thanks..... cant comment on the breakfast, we always sleep so well we never make it, but there is a cafe across the road by gunnersbury tube that is useful. could do with some more luxe toiletries and a mini bar, but overall a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars for a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: GemmaSwansea
Reviews.Content: Very nice. Comfy beds, nice breakfast and good location. The hotel is on the district line, so was very easy to get to Kensington, Earls park etc and easy to access tube to the west end. I did notice that the staff kept getting abuse from customers. They remained polite even when I had had enough of people moaning all the time, and wanted to tell them to shut up myself lol. Breakfast on the Saturday was continental and £5 each extra for cooked, but all was included on the Sunday for no extra charge. Bathroom was funky although the shower appeared to have no head. This is the way they all are apparently. We think that because the pressure is so great the head probably flew off. Only complaint is the parking is a rip off!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find and Great Connections to the City”
Reviews.Author: MinMcLeod
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Travel Republic after almost three days of looking for a room for the Challenge Cup Final (wish I hadn't but the scores are another story......!) Anyway, we were a little concerned regarding the location. We wanted to get to and from Wembley easily and having never been to Chiswick were a little nervous. On arrival (VERY easy to get to from main motorway network) we parked the car - underground (£10 per 24 hours for residents), cameras and very safe - and checked in. The reception was very light and modern with a large modern and comfy very well stocked bar to the left, large restaurant to the right. The staff were very pleasant, helpful and informative. We checked into room 316 at the front of the hotel and it was very clean, well appointed, modern with a huge bathroom. Consisted of large bath, walk in power shower, basin and toilet. The toiletries are OK but I would have expected a little better in keeping with the general outlook and furnishings of the hotel room. The room had a large double, tea and coffee, wifi access, TV, hairdryer, magazines and the most incredible amount of wardrobe and drawers I've ever seen, one of which held a full size ironing board and iron. We were given great directions to and from Wembley which turned out to be an easy journey. One tip: if you don't want to eat in the hotel restaurant (bit pricey) walk up Chiswick High Street (out the entrance, turn left) and keep walking for around 10 minutes, you'll come across a vast array of different restaurants - Lebanese, Thai, Italian etc. I can completely and wholeheartedly recommend the Thai Kitchen and Carluccio's (reviews to come shortly). All in all, a great stay (two nights), comfy, clean, affordable and well located. Couldn't fault the staff they were very helpful and obliging.

Reviews.Title: “Fab retro style and a bed to die for”
Reviews.Author: NorthEastNic
Reviews.Content: An amazing deal with Superbreak got us first class return travel and two nights bed and breakfast (double) for under £400...in effect the hotel came free!! We have stayed before - not long after it opened - and I think they have done quite a good job of keeping on top of it. Unlike other reviewers we had no problems with reception staff or any other staff for that matter. Weekend breakfast is different to weekday....seems so much busier at the weekend. Food was very good at breakfast and dinner. The room was well looked after, in all its retro fabulousness and the bed divine! With the tube just minutes away you can be in central London in 35 minutes. Kew Gardens and Richmond are really accessible. In two and a half days we got around in the centre of London, V&A, Mayfair, Covent Garden; Southbank for drinks one evening and the night bus back - stops right outside the hotel - as well as Richmond and Hampton Court Palace. The day travel card makes bus and tube really good value for money. Apart from blisters and some real heavy showers it was a great few days away. We would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tan36
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel and wasn't impressed. It's not cheap (£140 not including breakfast) and on top of the room rate they then charge you for internet (£15 for 24 hours). They do have free wi-fi in the bar but if you need peace and quiet to work that's not an option. The air conditioning in the rooms is centrally controlled so if you want to change the temperature you need to phone down to reception who change it for you and it takes half an hour to take effect. The windows do not open so you are the mercy of the air con and the receptionist .. wasn't impressed. I found the reception chaotic and we had to wait a long time to check-in and check-out. I stayed at this hotel a few years ago when it first opened and it was great but from my recent visit, standards have slipped considerably. The rooms are nice and large and well decorated but it's ruined somewhat by being too hot or freezing cold trying to get the air con right.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but location not ideal for London tourists”
Reviews.Author: Pangea422
Reviews.Content: Found this through TripAdvisor, but as a first time traveler to London (and Europe), it was a little out of the way for daily visits to London. And with all the work being done on the trains, it made for interesting adventures maneuvering through above ground and underground. It is only a few yards away from a train station, which is good though, IF the trains are running there. The hotel itself is more of a professional/business looking hotel as opposed to one for leisure travel. I asked if we could get two beds instead of the one king we booked and she upgraded us to a suite with a door that separated a single and a queen. The shower was nice and the bathroom was clean. The only bad thing was that you had to pay for internet. The hotel is I believe a mile or two from London city center, so you definitely have to invest anywhere from 15-30 minutes (depending on the time of day and what lines are open/closed that day), for travel into/out of London. Can't really fault it for its location, and the price was good (less than $150/night, which was around our budget). Other than that, the stay was nice and the rooms were comfortable, and there's a small town about 15 minute walk away. Nothing's really open at night though.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor - Reception staff rude & rooms dirty.”
Reviews.Author: HOTELGUEST000
Reviews.Content: I found that the reception staff were rude (perhaps if they learnt how to smile, it would be a start), the rooms dirty and the fact that I had a booked a late check out - ignored! On the two occasions that I booked a late check out, the maid came walking into the room and on the second occasion, someone from reception came to ask why I was still in the room, despite the fact that I had extended and paid for a late check out for a further 2 hrs. (Despite paying an hourly rate to extend the check out time, you will still find that the maid will want you to have vacated the room, 15 minutes prior to your extended time and again will come into the room to start preparing it for the next guest). Not at all good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Raj68
Reviews.Content: The Moran is a good place to stay, it is not far from the aiport and offers decent rooms with basic ameneties and services, the restaurants are not great or value for money but there are a lot of eating planes around. It is not in centra;l London and I wish the rooms had a refrigerator

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel..Great Decor..Almost perfect...”
Reviews.Author: fforbes212
Reviews.Content: When booking this hotel I didnt know what to expect...I have seen the previous posters pics..and reviews the majority good reviews...this not being my first time in London I felt a little more adventurous in staying a little bit out of the city center.I would have to say I was very pleased with my choice...for the quality of hotel if it were in the city center ..it would be out of my price range.So its a tradeoff.but not if you are familiar with the tube..The Gunnersbery tube stop is literally 1 block away.It is very efficient as is most of the tube system,,,and on time..taken 2 stops to hamersmith and transfer to the Picadilly line and you will be in the heart of London in about 15 min.If you want to stayout past 12 then there is a night bus that picks you up from Picadillly Circus and drops you a block from the hotel...these are things i figured out myself and am passing on the info...The hotel staff are efficient...not the most friendly...but hey i wasn't there to make friends..but a little smile now and then would not have hurt...One minor thing the maid staff has a tendency to walk in without knocking....keep your undies on..:).. I hope this helps you guys any questions feel free to ask.Pics will be posted of my room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - good value for money in a nice convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Walkers-Wombourne
Reviews.Content: Well appointed retro style modern rooms (with huge modern clean bathrooms) in a good location on Chiswick high street. Easy to drive too & park at - parking is reasonable for London at £10 for 24 hours. The tube station is just across the road - less than a 2 minute walk which is very convenient for getting about (the tube does take approx 30 mins to get into the main city centre). Good value for money (our rate included continental breakfast but we did pay £5 pp to upgrade to a full English which was worth doing for the extra) in a good location for getting to central London & surrounding areas. Very handy for Heathrow airport too. Would fully recommend staying here & intend to use again when visiting London.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel - enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: pete2216
Reviews.Content: Got a great price for this with Octopus travel - better than the Moran's own website and included buffet breakfast ( which was OK). Rooms a good size - bed massive. Staff very friendly and helpful. Lunch we had was quite good. Only problem was aircon wasnt working when we arrived and room was sweltering but asked for help and manager sorted it out. Good location too - not far from local tube.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: iloveskiathos1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel last October on a stay over in London. Plenty of parking spaces on a weekend , easy to find and also near the tube station. Rooms excellent, breakfast good with plenty of selection - irish breakfast - the full works - superb. Love the super ultra mod shag pile carpet in the rooms, beds really comfortable and not disturbed at all from the busy road it on, never heard a thing! The bar area "The Globe" very trendy, few celebs knocking around . Receptionists a little slow so if your in a hurry to check out then go before the rush hour at midday, was stood there over 15mins waiting . Would def stay again as very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A good West London location”
Reviews.Author: WayOutWest76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chiswick Moran for one night at the end of May. It is quite hard to find competitive rates for this hotel, but we did find one in the end for around £110 including a continental breakfast. A good hotel if you are in/out of Heathrow but want to pop into the centre of London for a night out. Gunnersbury Tube is only a few minutes walk away, so a trip in is easy. Heathrow is only about 15 minutes in a cab. The hotel itself is fine - decent sized rooms and bathrooms, good facilities and parking (£10 for overnight). If you need to be in West London, or have an early start for Heathrow but don't want to stay at the airport, this hotel is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good business class hotel - a bit sterile”
Reviews.Author: Anastasia1805
Reviews.Content: The Chiswick Moran is situated just a few hundred meters from the Chiswick business park and Gunnersbury tube station (to get there from Heathrow you need to change at Hammersmith). The rooms were very spacy and my room was fitted with a bath and for british standards luxury sanitary facilities. Everything was neatly clean. The interior however was styled in retro 70s colours (brown, green, orange) not exactly my style. The insulation of the windows was good, so though the hotel is situated at a very busy road, the rooms are quiet. Unfortunately they are fully air-conditioned, the windows can not be opened and I had some trouble preventing the fan from making noises throughout the night (it persistantely came back on). There are some very nice, very british pubs at the river, which can be accessed by a short 10 minute walk to Kew bridge and turning left besides the bridge. It is also not far to Kew Gardens and Richmond from here, which are beautifull little places, you wouldn´t think you are in a million residents city here. Breakfast was very basic and there was an extra charge made for cooked breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location and accomodation; with safe parking and close connection via underground to Central London.”
Reviews.Author: Whitedollypops
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful and polite. A high standard of facilities decor and cleanliness. Family room very comfortable and spacious. Good selection of breakfast on offer. Safe parking and reasonably priced for residents of hotel. Underground a short walk from hotel with good connections into Central London. Very impressed with our stay here, we will definately stay here again. Excellent value for money. Very quiet when we stayed thanks to the volcanic ash grounding all the planes.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Joey-Cope
Reviews.Content: Moran hotel Chiswick Reception greeted us with a smile, and although we had arrived several hours early our room was ready and we had been upgraded, excellent bathroom and a very comfortable bedroom. Having read previous reviewers comments about the slow breakfast service we where pleasantly surprised by attentive staff on two of our three days stay, but on day three the service collapsed, there appeared to be little or no staff on duty, tables not cleared, repeated request for coffee and for the empty buffet table to be refilled were firstly ignored then responded to very slowly.
